intro: Daphnopsis cestrifolia, commonly known as the creeping daphnopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
